rComments: John Hay is a really sweet and nice guy and I'd maybe want him as a grandpa- not as a professor!  His lectures are SO BORING I wanted to shoot myself. He speaks in this boring monotone voice as if he were dead and does this clearing throat thing every ten seconds. Once I tallied it and it came out to be 117x.  Yes, I was THAT BORED.
A very nice, helpful, intelligent, interesting, and knowledgeable prof, but his lectures are extremely boring, probably because his voice can easily be mistaken for background noise and ignored.

I LOVED prof. hay. He is extremely knowledgable in his field, has an impressive background, and is always available to help his students. Take advantage of doing the readings and contributing in class discussion; you will do great!
Prof. Hay teaches with no structural content. His lectures are hard to follow even with a dying interest. He is very unorganized and speaks in a monotone voice.

ahhh, so boring you could physically hurt yourself! His lectures are random and without structure, even his tests and papers are vague. The book was utterly boring! If you are looking to learn about the cultural background of art DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS! If you want to waste 3 hours of your week (just in class, no reading) DO take this class!

He is an EXTREMELY BORING instructor. He goes on tangents and is very hard to follow. If you're okay with a sleeping period, take him...but even sleeping doesn't help in his classes. Maybe banging your head constantly on the desk may help ease the pain of his boring lectures. This class will put you in an intellectual coma...
